job_descriptions.title: Senior Python Developer
job_descriptions.description:
We are seeking a Senior Python Developer to join our growing engineering team. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience developing scalable web applications using Python, Django, and modern cloud technologies.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design and develop robust backend systems using Python and Django
- Work with PostgreSQL databases and optimize query performance
- Deploy applications on AWS using Docker and Kubernetes
- Collaborate with frontend teams to build RESTful APIs
- Mentor junior developers and conduct code reviews

Required Skills:
- 5+ years of Python development experience
- Strong experience with Django framework
- Proficiency in PostgreSQL and database design
- Experience with AWS services (EC2, RDS, S3)
- Knowledge of Docker and containerization
- Understanding of RESTful API design principles
- Git version control and CI/CD pipelines

Preferred Skills:
- Experience with Redis for caching
- Knowledge of microservices architecture
- Familiarity with GraphQL
- Experience with monitoring tools (DataDog, New Relic)

Location: San Francisco, CA (Hybrid)
Salary: $120,000 - $160,000

job_descriptions.title: Frontend React Developer
job_descriptions.description:
Join our fast-paced startup as a Frontend React Developer! We're building the next generation of e-commerce platforms and need talented developers who are passionate about creating amazing user experiences.

What you'll do:
- Build responsive web applications using React and TypeScript
- Implement modern UI/UX designs with attention to detail
- Integrate with backend APIs and manage application state
- Optimize application performance and ensure cross-browser compatibility
- Work closely with designers and product managers

What we're looking for:
- 3+ years of React development experience
- Strong proficiency in JavaScript ES6+ and TypeScript
- Experience with state management (Redux, Zustand, or Context API)
- Knowledge of modern CSS frameworks (Tailwind, Styled Components)
- Familiarity with testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library)
- Understanding of modern build tools (Webpack, Vite)
- Git workflow and collaborative development

Bonus points:
- Next.js or other React frameworks
- Experience with GraphQL
- Mobile development (React Native)
- E-commerce platform experience

Location: Remote (US timezone)
Salary: $80,000 - $120,000

job_descriptions.title: DevOps Engineer
job_descriptions.description:
We're looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to help scale our infrastructure and improve our deployment processes. You'll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and help build robust, automated systems.

Responsibilities:
- Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and GitLab
- Manage Kubernetes clusters and container orchestration
- Implement Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
- Monitor system performance and implement alerting
- Ensure security best practices across all environments
- Automate deployment and scaling processes

Required Experience:
- 4+ years in DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering
- Strong experience with Kubernetes and Docker
- Proficiency with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
- Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
- Knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions)
- Scripting skills in Python, Bash, or Go
- Understanding of networking and security principles

Preferred Skills:
- Helm charts and Kubernetes operators
- Service mesh technologies (Istio, Linkerd)
- Monitoring stack (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK)
- Database administration (PostgreSQL, MongoDB)

Location: Austin, TX (Remote friendly)
Salary: $110,000 - $150,000

job_descriptions.title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning
job_descriptions.description:
Join our AI team as a Data Scientist focused on machine learning model development and deployment. You'll work on challenging problems in computer vision, NLP, and predictive analytics.

What you'll work on:
- Develop and deploy machine learning models for production use
- Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights
- Build data pipelines and feature engineering systems
- Collaborate with engineering teams to integrate ML models
- Research and implement state-of-the-art ML techniques

Required Qualifications:
- MS/PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field
- 3+ years of hands-on machine learning experience
- Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
- Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)
- Knowledge of statistical analysis and hypothesis testing
- Experience with cloud ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, GCP AI Platform)
- Proficiency with data manipulation libraries (Pandas, NumPy)

Preferred Experience:
- Deep learning and neural network architectures
- Computer vision or NLP specialization
- MLOps and model deployment pipelines
- Big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop)
- A/B testing and experimentation frameworks

Location: New York, NY
Salary: $130,000 - $180,000
